N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2835.2 - Conflict of interest

State Regulations
(a) No
member of the board of directors of the company, nor any member of their
immediate families, shall receive financial renumeration directly or indirectly
under this program. (b) No member
of the board of directors or staff of the company, nor any member of their
immediate families, shall benefit financially, either directly or indirectly, from activities of the board unless: such action is necessary for the
accomplishment of activities; such relationship has been disclosed to the
division; and written approval has been granted by the commissioner. (c) No voting member of the board of
directors or paid staff of the company, nor any member of their immediate
families or personal staff, shall: (1)
hold a
publicly elected position at or above the State level, unless board membership
of elected officials is mandated by other relevant Federal or State statutes. Voting members of the board of directors who serve as elected public officials
at the local level must constitute less than a majority of the board's total
membership; or
(2)
serve as a
member of a political party's executive committee at any jurisdictional
level. (d) None of the
persons performing functions listed in subdivision (c) of this section, or
their immediate families, shall receive financial renumeration, either directly
or indirectly, under this program. (e) No person shall serve in a management
capacity for more than one company under this program, whether or not
compensation is received for such service. Notes
